e theories are simply not testable. That is not debunking.

 to join. I am not really scientific, I just take the approach, try differe=
nt methods, see what works. I go on the results I get"

ly for those who believe what we do".

ng or trying to do.... If you don't have a box to work with or listen to, h=
ow can you be skeptical about
what someone hears regardless of whether they=
 write out what they hear or not? Alot of times we don't hear
the same thin=
gs ,so it is ridiculous for people to believe it's the power of suggestion.=

Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Scamp,


=C2=A0 





I realize you have p=
lenty of subjective anecdotal evidence.I don't consider that 'hard evidence=
' however.=C2=A0 I am looking for something a little more objective and les=
s subject to influence and interpretations.


And stop putting words in my =
mouth. A person can misinterpret something, mistake something, or confuse s=
omething, without lying about something.=C2=A0 And before you jump down my =
throat claiming I am saying all results are mistakes, I am not.=C2=A0 I am =
performing experiments, keeping an open mind, and considering all evidence =
I find. 


The way you have been attacking me by calling me names at every =
turn, just because I try new things and don't always agree with your world =
view, is eerily reminiscent of the way the church of old tried to suppress =
new thought and discoveries, except you're just substituting the word 'here=
tic' with 'science'. and 'blasphemy' with anything that disagrees with you.=



There's an old saying:=C2=A0 "We become that which we hate".=C2=A0 So fa=
r, all you've done is denounce people's efforts to try new methods and see =
what works.=C2=A0 You accept nothing anyone else proposes if it does not ag=
ree with you.=C2=A0 That is the realm of the extreme skeptic: the same skep=
tic you ridicule.

=C2=A0
You certainly don't have to agree with my comment=
s.=C2=A0 And I don't have to agree with yours.=C2=A0 But no one needs all t=
he name calling Frank.=C2=A0=C2=A0 It really adds nothing to support your t=
heories.

Some people claim the=

y "whats the object" experiment is one way to examine that.=C2=A0 Some peop=
le claim the boxes can make predictions, so cataloging predictions and exam=
ining the results can help examine that.=C2=A0 If there are other claims, I=
 will try to figure experiments based on those.

body>
<tr>
<td valign=3D"top">I realize you have plenty of subjective anecd=
otal evidence.I don't consider that 'hard evidence' however.  I am loo=
king for something a little more objective and less subject to influence an=
d interpretations.<br>
<br>And stop putting words in my mouth. A person can=
 misinterpret something, mistake something, or confuse something, without l=
ying about something.  And before you jump down my throat claiming I a=
m saying all results are mistakes, I am not.  I am performing experime=
nts, keeping an open mind, and considering all evidence I find. <br>
<br>Th=
e way you have been attacking me by calling me names at every turn, just be=
cause I try new things and don't always agree with your world view, is eeri=
ly reminiscent of the way the church of old tried to suppress new thought a=
nd discoveries, except you're just substituting the word 'heretic' with 'sc=
ience'. and 'blasphemy' with anything that disagrees with you.<br>
<br>Ther=
e's an old saying:  "We become that which we hate".  So far, all =
you've done is denounce people's efforts to try new methods and see what wo=
rks.  You accept nothing anyone else proposes if it does not agree wit=
h you.  That is the realm of the extreme skeptic: the same skeptic you=
 ridicule.<br>
 <br>You certainly don't have to agree with my comments=
.  And I don't have to agree with yours.  But no one needs all th=
e name calling Frank.   It really adds nothing to support your th=
eories.<br><br><br><br>--- On <b>Sun, 8/22/10, Frank Sumption <i><<a rel=
=3D"nofollow" ymailto=3D"mailto:purplealiengirl@..." target=3D"_blank=
" href=3D"/mc/compose?to=3Dpurplealiengirl@...">purplealiengirl@gmail=

<div> Yeah =

<div> </div>
<div> How irrationa=
l is it to ignore all evidence and continuously try to fit the phenomon int=
o a diffintion where it will not fit and does not belong, and then claim yo=
u're looking for a more rational explantation, it just does not make sense.=
 I say forget the BS "science" whatever that is, puts out and try thinking =
on your own.  Mr Spock was a fictional charactor!</div>

<td valign=3D"top">I don't th=
ink I have enough data yet to make any conclusions, so I plan more experime=
nts.  Since there are different distinct claims about what the box or =
the recorders can do, I try to make different distinct experiments for each=
.<br>
<br>Some people claim they can get the box to tell them things that t=
he operator couldn't know, so my "whats the object" experiment is one way t=
o examine that.  Some people claim the boxes can make predictions, so =
cataloging predictions and examining the results can help examine that.&nbs=
p; If there are other claims, I will try to figure experiments based on tho=
se.<br>
